page.title: 07 AYNHO CHURCH
page.content: The church of St. Michael, Aynho, has a 14th. century {TOWER} which contains 8 bells, the earliest dated 1603. A carrilon plays tunes on the bells evry 3 hrs. during the day. The {NAVE} was rebuilt in 1723 in the classical style. There are 4 blocks of box pews, one of which incorporates the choir pews. At the west end there is a gallery. The chancel is very short and there are no pillars. There are many monuments to the Cartwright family and an organ. {CHURCH ACTIVITIES} are many. There is a choir, a team of bellringers who ring the bells, 2 Bible study groups and an overseas missionary group. The Parochial Church Council is responsible for running the church which is in Peterborough Diocese. The {RECTOR}, who lives in Aynho, is also responsible for St.James,Newbottle
